TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Scenarios implements class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: A collection of all the objects on the specified worksheet. A scenario is a group of input values (called ) that’s named and saved.

remarks.para: Use the method to return the Scenarios collection.
Use the method to create a new scenario and add it to the collection.
Use Scenarios(), where is the scenario name or index number, to return a single Scenario object.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.Scenario Add (string Name, object ChangingCells, object Values, object Comment, object Locked, object Hidden);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.Scenario Add([in]string Name, [in]object ChangingCells, [in]object Values, [in]object Comment, [in]object Locked, [in]object Hidden) runtime managed
Public Function Add (Name As String, ChangingCells As Object, Optional Values As Object, Optional Comment As Object, Optional Locked As Object, Optional Hidden As Object) As Scenario

Docs.param: Required Object. A object that refers to the changing cells for the scenario.
Optional Object. An array that contains the scenario values for the cells in . If this argument is omitted, the scenario values are assumed to be the current values in the cells in .
Optional Object. A string that specifies comment text for the scenario. When a new scenario is added, the author's name and date are automatically added at the beginning of the comment text.
Optional Object. True to lock the scenario to prevent changes. The default value is True.
Optional Object. True to hide the scenario. The default value is False.
Docs.summary: Creates a new scenario and adds it to the list of scenarios that are available for the current worksheet.

remarks.para: A scenario name must be unique; Microsoft Excel generates an error if you try to create a scenario with a name that's already in use.

Docs.summary: Returns the number of objects in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public object CreateSummary (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlSummaryReportType ReportType = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlSummaryReportType.xlStandardSummary, object ResultCells);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object CreateSummary([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlSummaryReportType ReportType, [in]object ResultCells) runtime managed
Public Function CreateSummary (Optional ReportType As XlSummaryReportType = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlSummaryReportType.xlStandardSummary, Optional ResultCells As Object) As Object

Docs.param: Optional Object. A object that represents the result cells on the specified worksheet. Normally, this range refers to one or more cells containing the formulas that depend on the changing cell values for your model — that is, the cells that show the results of a particular scenario. If this argument is omitted, there are no result cells included in the report.
Docs.summary: Creates a new worksheet that contains a summary report for the scenarios on the specified worksheet.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlCreator Creator { get; }
.property instance valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlCreator Creator
Public ReadOnly Property Creator As XlCreator
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlCreator Creator { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlCreator get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which this object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Excel, this property returns the string XCEL, which is equivalent to the hexadecimal number 5843454C.
The Creator property is designed to be used in Microsoft Excel for the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Excel has the creator code XCEL.

Docs.param: Required Object. The name or index number for the object.
Docs.summary: Returns a single object from a collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Merge (object Source);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Merge([in]object Source) runtime managed
Public Function Merge (Source As Object) As Object
public: System::Object ^ Merge(System::Object ^ Source);

Docs.param: Required Object. The name of the sheet that contains scenarios to be merged, or a object that represents that sheet.
Docs.summary: Merges the scenarios from another sheet into the collection.

remarks.para: The value of a merged range is specified in the cell of the range's upper-left corner.
